vulnerabilities.description: Airtable Base ID exposed: appleLoginButtonOn
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Review Base ID usage and implement proper access controls
vulnerabilities.background: Airtable bases are identified by Base IDs which are used in API calls and internal routing. Exposing Base IDs can facilitate reconnaissance and unauthorized API usage when combined with leaked credentials.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker who obtains valid Base IDs can more easily target specific bases, attempt credential stuffing against corresponding APIs, or correlate other leaked information to pivot into data exfiltration attacks.

vulnerabilities.background: Airtable bases are identified by Base IDs which are used in API calls and internal routing. Exposing Base IDs can facilitate reconnaissance and unauthorized API usage when combined with leaked credentials.

vulnerabilities.description: Airtable Base ID exposed: AppCreationDetaile
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Review Base ID usage and implement proper access controls
vulnerabilities.background: Airtable bases are identified by Base IDs which are used in API calls and internal routing. Exposing Base IDs can facilitate reconnaissance and unauthorized API usage when combined with leaked credentials.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker who obtains valid Base IDs can more easily target specific bases, attempt credential stuffing against corresponding APIs, or correlate other leaked information to pivot into data exfiltration attacks.

vulnerabilities.description: Airtable Base ID exposed: AppSetupLoggedInAd
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Review Base ID usage and implement proper access controls
vulnerabilities.background: Airtable bases are identified by Base IDs which are used in API calls and internal routing. Exposing Base IDs can facilitate reconnaissance and unauthorized API usage when combined with leaked credentials.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker who obtains valid Base IDs can more easily target specific bases, attempt credential stuffing against corresponding APIs, or correlate other leaked information to pivot into data exfiltration attacks.

vulnerabilities.description: Airtable Base ID exposed: AppSetupInternalFe
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Review Base ID usage and implement proper access controls
vulnerabilities.background: Airtable bases are identified by Base IDs which are used in API calls and internal routing. Exposing Base IDs can facilitate reconnaissance and unauthorized API usage when combined with leaked credentials.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker who obtains valid Base IDs can more easily target specific bases, attempt credential stuffing against corresponding APIs, or correlate other leaked information to pivot into data exfiltration attacks.

vulnerabilities.description: Airtable Base ID exposed: AppSetupDeprecateL
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Review Base ID usage and implement proper access controls
vulnerabilities.background: Airtable bases are identified by Base IDs which are used in API calls and internal routing. Exposing Base IDs can facilitate reconnaissance and unauthorized API usage when combined with leaked credentials.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker who obtains valid Base IDs can more easily target specific bases, attempt credential stuffing against corresponding APIs, or correlate other leaked information to pivot into data exfiltration attacks.

vulnerabilities.description: Airtable Base ID exposed: AppSetupVisualizat
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Review Base ID usage and implement proper access controls
vulnerabilities.background: Airtable bases are identified by Base IDs which are used in API calls and internal routing. Exposing Base IDs can facilitate reconnaissance and unauthorized API usage when combined with leaked credentials.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker who obtains valid Base IDs can more easily target specific bases, attempt credential stuffing against corresponding APIs, or correlate other leaked information to pivot into data exfiltration attacks.

vulnerabilities.recommendation: Review Base ID usage and implement proper access controls
vulnerabilities.background: Airtable bases are identified by Base IDs which are used in API calls and internal routing. Exposing Base IDs can facilitate reconnaissance and unauthorized API usage when combined with leaked credentials.

vulnerabilities.description: Airtable Base ID exposed: applicationChangeH
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Review Base ID usage and implement proper access controls
vulnerabilities.background: Airtable bases are identified by Base IDs which are used in API calls and internal routing. Exposing Base IDs can facilitate reconnaissance and unauthorized API usage when combined with leaked credentials.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker who obtains valid Base IDs can more easily target specific bases, attempt credential stuffing against corresponding APIs, or correlate other leaked information to pivot into data exfiltration attacks.

vulnerabilities.description: Airtable Base ID exposed: AppIdQualifiedPage
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Review Base ID usage and implement proper access controls
vulnerabilities.background: Airtable bases are identified by Base IDs which are used in API calls and internal routing. Exposing Base IDs can facilitate reconnaissance and unauthorized API usage when combined with leaked credentials.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker who obtains valid Base IDs can more easily target specific bases, attempt credential stuffing against corresponding APIs, or correlate other leaked information to pivot into data exfiltration attacks.

vulnerabilities.recommendation: Review Base ID usage and implement proper access controls
vulnerabilities.background: Airtable bases are identified by Base IDs which are used in API calls and internal routing. Exposing Base IDs can facilitate reconnaissance and unauthorized API usage when combined with leaked credentials.

vulnerabilities.description: Airtable Base ID exposed: ApplicationHandoff
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Review Base ID usage and implement proper access controls
vulnerabilities.background: Airtable bases are identified by Base IDs which are used in API calls and internal routing. Exposing Base IDs can facilitate reconnaissance and unauthorized API usage when combined with leaked credentials.
vulnerabilities.impact: An attacker who obtains valid Base IDs can more easily target specific bases, attempt credential stuffing against corresponding APIs, or correlate other leaked information to pivot into data exfiltration attacks.

vulnerabilities.description: Potential secret found in JavaScript: c3c0305f30...
vulnerabilities.background: Secrets embedded in JavaScript code are exposed to anyone who can access the application. This includes API keys, passwords, tokens, and other sensitive credentials that should never be stored in client-side code.
vulnerabilities.impact: Exposed secrets allow attackers to directly access backend services, APIs, or databases. This can lead to complete system compromise, data breaches, and unauthorized access to critical systems and data.

vulnerabilities.description: CSP contains weak directives: style-src 'unsafe-inline' https:; block-all-mixed-content; object-src 'none'; base-uri 'none'; repor...
vulnerabilities.evidence: {'type': 'exact', 'pattern': "Content-Security-Policy: style-src 'unsafe-inline' https:; block-all-mixed-content; object-src 'none'; base-uri 'none'; report-uri https://airtable.com/.csp/report; script-src 'nonce-T2hoJSMhSWnh' 'unsafe-inline' 'strict-dynamic' 'report-sample' https:"}
vulnerabilities.background: Content Security Policy should avoid unsafe directives like 'unsafe-inline' and 'unsafe-eval' which defeat the purpose of CSP by allowing inline scripts and dynamic code execution.
vulnerabilities.impact: Weak CSP directives allow XSS attacks to bypass protections, making the policy ineffective against code injection attacks. This provides a false sense of security while remaining vulnerable.

vulnerabilities.description: Weak X-Frame-Options value: SAMEORIGIN
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Use DENY or SAMEORIGIN with proper validation
vulnerabilities.background: X-Frame-Options should use 'DENY' or 'SAMEORIGIN' for proper protection. The 'allow-from' directive is deprecated and may not be supported by all browsers.
vulnerabilities.impact: Weak X-Frame-Options values may not provide adequate protection against clickjacking attacks, potentially allowing malicious sites to embed your content in unintended ways.

vulnerabilities.description: HTTPS response may be cached
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Implement proper cache control for sensitive pages
vulnerabilities.background: HTTPS responses without proper cache control headers may be stored by intermediate caches, potentially exposing sensitive data to unauthorized parties who can access cached content.
vulnerabilities.impact: Cacheable HTTPS responses can lead to sensitive information being stored in shared caches, allowing unauthorized access to private data and potentially violating privacy regulations.

vulnerabilities.description: AJAX requests may lack security headers
vulnerabilities.background: AJAX requests without proper security headers like X-Requested-With can be vulnerable to CSRF attacks. These headers help servers distinguish between legitimate AJAX requests and malicious cross-site requests.
vulnerabilities.impact: Missing AJAX security headers increases the risk of CSRF attacks, where malicious websites can make unauthorized AJAX requests on behalf of authenticated users, potentially leading to data theft or unauthorized actions.
